meanings.definition: A road or passage that avoids a built-up area, congestion, or obstruction.
meanings.sent1: The new bypass around town saved us a lot of time.
meanings.sent2: Drivers took the bypass to avoid the traffic jam.
meanings.sent3: The bypass road decided to skip the city and take a scenic route instead.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a bypass to the usual way of doing things.
meanings.sent5: The bypass through the countryside was a peaceful escape from the noisy city.

meanings.definition: A surgical procedure in which a diseased or obstructed blood vessel is circumvented.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended a bypass to improve blood flow.
meanings.sent2: After the bypass surgery, his heart function improved.
meanings.sent3: The bypass operation made his heart feel like a detour was taken.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted as a bypass to the obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The bypass around the blocked artery was like a new path for blood to travel.
